content: **Components:** V, S, M (a mummified ear, and a golden magnifying glass worth at least 50g)

With a light chime that only you can hear, you are notified every time a magical Illusion enters or is cast within 60ft of you for the duration. When you look at an Illusion, and only while you are looking directly at it, the Illusion will appear translucent to only you. Similarly, a low tremble that only you can hear occurs whenever another creature makes a Deception check within 60ft of you for the duration, even when they are speaking a language that you do not understand. If you watch them as they make this Deception check, their words and actions appear to float around them, a vision that only you can see.

With your fingers twisted into a claw, a wave of destruction sweeps before you. Each creature with the 30ft cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. They take 5d6 Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Flammable objects and creatures in this area are afflicted with the Burning condition for 1 hour. If the cone’s area includes the ground, the area becomes Desecrated Land for 1 hour.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4rd.
**Components:** V, M (an enchanted slashing or piercing weapon worth at least 300g)

After a droll incantation that ends with a swift stab, you turn what would have been a serious self-inflicted wound into a surge of power, using your own life force as the catalyst. The damage that you deal with spells and class features ignores the damage reduction of Resistances, for the duration. Furthermore, the damage you deal with a spell or class feature is only halved when harming a creature that would otherwise be Immune to the damage, for the duration.
**Components:** V, S, M (a Perilous Pebble, consumed)
One willing creature you touch is protected from the most common forms of deific assault. The ward grants immunity to the Afraid, Blinded, Deafened and Terrified conditions for the duration.

You strike a weapon upon the ground in front of you in a dramatic flourish, filling your weapon with a fleeting yet stubborn power. The weapon’s damage ignores the damage reduction of Resistances, for the duration. Furthermore, the weapon’s damage is only halved when striking a creature that would otherwise be Immune to the weapon’s damages, for the duration.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 3rd level spell slot, you can affect an additional weapon for each slot above 2nd.

You release a wave of lethargy, darkening the ground before you. The affected area becomes Desecrated Land for the duration, and non-magical plants within it visibly wilt and dry out. Casting this spell onto Desecrated Land also makes the area Rough Terrain. Casting this spell onto the same area 3 days in a row will make the Desecrated Land effect along that area permanent.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 2nd level spell slot, the affected area increases by (+10ft line, +0ft wide) for each slot level above 1st.

For the duration, you sense the presence of religious faith in creatures within 30ft of you. If you sense faith in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature that holds religious faith, and you learn the name of the entity that they have faith in.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.
You recite unholy scripture that surrounds you in a sinister whirl of desecrating energy. You treat your space, and the spaces adjacent to you as Desecrated Land for the duration.
You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

1x/day, when you touch a creature that sees you as an ally, temporarily or otherwise, you may choose to make them forget meeting you, and ever having known you. Their memories that included you will either omit you, or replace you, where appropriate. If there are images of you that the target owns, you fade from the image, leaving only a vanta black silhouette and a vague recollection that the target knew the Golead
